topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Diagnosis of disk health using hpssacli utility for HPE servers

body.p: The health of the disk of the HPE servers can be diagnosed using the hpsacli utility.

section.title: HPE Smart Storage Administrator CLI 2.0.22.0 (HPSSACLI)
section.p: The HPE Smart Storage Administrator CLI (HPSSACLI) is a command line disk configuration program for Smart Array Controllers.

section.title: Deployment
section.p: The hpssacli utility is deployed onto the servers wherever the disks are to be monitored, usually all Swift, VSA, and Compute nodes. This page explains the collection of diagnostic reports from disks in the servers where the utility has been loaded.

section.title: Download the hpssacli debian package into the KVM host
Copy the debian to seed and to the servers where the disks has to be monitored
section.p: Use scp to copy the utility package on to the servers and install it.

ol.li: Copy the package from KVM host to SEED.# scp scp "hpssacli-2.0-16.0_amd64.deb" root@<IP address of Seed>
Copy the package from SEED to machine where the disks to be monitored.# scp scp "hpssacli-2.0-16.0_amd64.deb" heat-admin@<IP address of machine>
Log in to the server where the debian is copied and install the package.# ssh heat-admin@<IP address of machine>

List the files.# ls
All the files present in that directory will be displayed.

Install the following package.# dpkg -i hpssacli-2.0-16.0_amd64.deb
The diagnostics can be done in the server or from SEED through ssh.
You can collect the diagnostic report of the controller either in server or through Seed using ssh.

section.title: Collect the diagnostic report

ol.li:
Enter the following command to determine the controller slot.# hpssacli ctrl all show status
The following sample displays slot details:Smart Array P420i in Slot 0 (Embedded)
Controller Status: OK
Cache Status: OK
Battery/Capacitor Status: OK

Generate the diagnostic report for a particular slot.# hpssacli ctrl slot=(slot number) diag file=<filename.zip>
Or Generate the report for all the slots# hpssacli ctrl all diag file=<filename.zip>
The file will be stored in the selected location.
Copy the generated file to the desired location.
Generate the diagnostic report of the particular slot. ssh heat-admin@<Machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> diag file=details_slot_<slot number>.zip"
Copy the report from the server to Seed VM.# scp heat-admin@<Machine IP address>:/home/heat-admin/<filename.zip>
Copy the report <filename.zip> to the KVM_host# scp details_slot_<slot number>.zip ubuntu@<KVM_Host IP address>:
Open the ADUReport.htm file in the browser. The html page displays complete details of the controller and the health status of the physical disks available in the machine.

Generate SmartSSD Wear Gauge Report from either the local server or from the seed:
From the local server
# hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> diag file=<filename.zip> ssdrpt=on
From the seed
# ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> diag file=<filename.zip>

li.p: To get the details of the physical disks and also the logical group status on the server

codeblock.codeph: ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli ctrl slot=<slot number> show config detail"

li.p: To execute other operations on physical drives

codeblock.codeph: ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli help physicaldrive"

li.p: Open the help to explore other options with the utility

codeblock.codeph: ssh heat-admin@<machine IP address> "sudo hpssacli help"
